website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty board that will not dull knives or harbor bacteria. Hands down the best board available.
pros: Can also be used as a pastry board
cons: Must be oiled and washed by hand between uses

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money like I did
customer_reviews.text: Looked nice for about a month then it started to split right down the middle. My cheaper bamboo cutting board is considerably higher quality. So far I have heard nothing but crickets from the John Boos company. I thought this was a good brand but I have learned they are very poor quality and I wasted good money on a junk product. I would never purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Herd

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this John Boos cutting board on July 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this John Boos cutting board on July 3, 2016. I noticed the first crack about Thanksgiving and today (1/9/2017) I noticed 4 more cracks. This board resides inside except when using near my grill and I treat the board with Boos mystery oil every 2 months. What to do now?
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dreher

customer_reviews.title: Splitting in less than 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand, I have had this cutting board for less than 3 months and it's splitting like crazy. I've done exactly as the instructions specify to clean and oil it. Do not buy this model. It's awful.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, even in ideal circumstances
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research, I bought this, thinking it would last. We treat it like a family heirloom, following the recommended care and maintenance to the letter (including Boos brand oil!). It's only been used maybe a dozen times, and one of ends is already splitting from it's neighbor, and another slat is starting to split across the grain! It's still a big, heavy chunk of wood, which is 80% of what you need, but for this price, you'd expect it to outperform a board that's a third as much.
customer_reviews.author: Roy S.

customer_reviews.title: Cracking after 60 days.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December. Bought the Boos oil and cream and oiled it well. Now it has a crack forming. Very disappointed. Don’t waste your eir warranty is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: 123Guymon

customer_reviews.title: Cracking block
customer_reviews.text: This block is cracking open into several pieces. Yes, I did apply a natural oil finish on it.We have only used it twice and it is severely cracking open.We can't use it anymore ,as any liquid seeps through the cracks . I suppose I can't return it.Is there anything that can be done to help me out?
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra van Marle

customer_reviews.title: 6 months out of warranty and it’s splitting, even after proper monthly maintenance!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been maintaining it with the mystery oil and board cream, but a year and a half after purchasing it, the board is splitting along the lines where the pieces are glued together.. and the warranty is only for 1 year! I contacted customer service and they told me “sorry, you need to figure out how to repair it yourself”. Needless to say, I’ll be buying elsewhere next time when looking for a quality board.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk! Horrendous customer service! Split within a year and they refused to replace or repair because I called a couple months after the splitting started (thinking it was just settling but then got much worse). Absolute trash. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Arana

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two in November 2017. One cracked within the first use, returned it, and got a new one. It is now March, and BOTH are cracked in several places after maybe 3 uses. Very disappointed. Not sure what the hype is all about with this brand?
customer_reviews.author: brian sturgeon

customer_reviews.title: Not same quality that is sold in kitchen stores
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with the condition of this cutting board. I have followed instructions to condition it with Boos oil. It still remains a rough surface. I do not recommend purchasing this product from amazon. The Boos boards that my friends have purchased from quality kitchen stores have a smoother surface and cost the same.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Useless after three months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Block three months ago for a very good friend who opened his first restaurant. We have worked together for over 20 years and i new he would live this as a gift. I was right, when i gave him this he loved it and couldn't thank me enough. Now after three months of use,it is useless. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: michael young

customer_reviews.title: massive bomb proof cutting board (as long as it doesn't split)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is seriously thick and heavy. Not really friendly for moving around the kitchen or washing in the sink since it is so large. Definitely not warping anytime soon but mine did split a little on one of the edges about a week after purchasing even though I oil and wax it regularly (every week or so). Doesn't affect it it's usability but it is a noticeable blemish and sometimes you can snag your finger or sponge on it.
customer_reviews.author: Shockhammer3

customer_reviews.title: but I would expect a high quality product to have fairly good quality control
customer_reviews.text: The cutting board is built extremely well; however, it seems prone to warping even with both sides being used evenly and properly cleaned. It's a shame because I've never had a sturdier cutting board, but have noticed the warping after only 6 months of use. Could just be a defective one, but I would expect a high quality product to have fairly good quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic cutting board
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic cutting board. But, it is HUGE! I knew how large 24x18 was, but I didn't really recognize the magnitude until I got it. Also, it is SUPER THICK. These two things combined make it very heavy. If you are looking for a board for your house, and you don't have an industrial sized kitchen, then I would recommend getting a smaller one, or at least get a thinner one (same size, but it is 1.5 inches thick). It is beautiful, very durable, and a dream to cut on, but it is just too big for me. I am returning it because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An investment piece!
customer_reviews.text: Hands-down the best block I have ever invested in. Till this date, I used to buy a lot of cheaper blocks as I did not know the difference between the good and the okay ones. Neither was I aware that good quality block even exists until I found Boos block. The stability is incredible. My previous bamboo blocks used to move a lot and as a result used to have a lot of bruises on my fingers. Boos block is a little heavy than I’m used to, but it is completely worth it. Make sure that you buy the brush and the oil to maintain it. It is definitely an investment
customer_reviews.author: Dhwani Parikh

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: IN love with my Boos bloc, but don't take the care of these lightly. They require a lot of maintenance to keep them looking new and clean. You need to buy the mystery oil for sure!
customer_reviews.author: S. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Same as some other reviewers, we've had our board ...
customer_reviews.text: Same as some other reviewers, we've had our board for 3 months and it has cracked along the glue line. Never soaked in water and all instructions have been followed. I'm outside of the return window now and Boos customer service refuses to assist. Please save your money.
customer_reviews.author: katie hanley

customer_reviews.title: I would like the missing packet please
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these cutting boards. One came with a packet of "Boos Mystery Oil" to treat the wood and the other did not. I would like the missing packet please. I cannot use the boards for food prep without treating them first with oil. At over $100 each I would hope the packaging would be the same. I considered ordering another but would like this minor issue dealt with first. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: FLGRL

customer_reviews.title: Butcher Block...disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this product, we have taken such extra care of it, bought the oil and treat the butcher block with utmost care. My complete disappointment is that the butcher block has split. I cant believe I spent the money for this block and thought it would last for years and years. How can this product be so inferior that after only a few months it has so many cracks. I would like very much like for someone to contact me regarding this, I will be extremely annoyed if this is not addressed. This item is a good name brand and expensive
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Monaco

customer_reviews.title: This mother is huge and heavy!
customer_reviews.text: But worth the money.. I love it, just be prepared for its size and thickness. If you have a small work area, get a smaller size. The 24x18 is mammoth, but impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Welch II

customer_reviews.title: Great board, but it may split
customer_reviews.text: So, mine split on me. I took good care of it: oiled it regularly and never left it in water. I have never had a problem with a John Boos board before, so I think I just got an unlocked board. I was able to return it no-questions-asked, which is why I won't take off another star or two.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Splitting after 6 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Great butcher block cutting board for about a month and half till it started to split
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Bad product is one thing
customer_reviews.text: I had it for one year and 3 months and it cracked exactly one year after I bought it. I reversed it and now it is delaminating. The food it now getting in the crack.delamination and it starts to rot.... Bad product is one thing, bad and expensive product is another thing!!! I am not happy for having paid that much money for a cutting block that is no better for I could have gotten at Target for $30. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Michel Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: Cracked and warped
customer_reviews.text: Product was slightly warped when it arrived. Figured it would correct over time with conditioning and laying flat. Even though we used the Boos Mystery Oil on a near-weekly basis, the board continued to warp further and now has a 7" crack in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I want even leave this board out on the counter.
customer_reviews.text: The board came extremely dry, it wasn't even used yet and it looked worn. I used the product they recommended and it is still doesnt look like it should. This was a birthday gift that was a big let down. I expected more from the Boos products. The ultimate sting is I cant return it because the deadline passed. They didn't extend the return time duration for Covid 19 and I was unable to leave my home for months, thats why I purchased online in the first place. Usually, I go into Williams and Sonoma and purchase in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Renee M Kolczak

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful hunk of wood
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to many years of chopping with this baby. Tip: Cut a piece of rug gripper to put between the counter and cutting board so it doesn’t slide around.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn

customer_reviews.title: and looked like it had been dropped on gravel
customer_reviews.text: The first board came packed with just a little paper, and looked like it had been dropped on gravel, with the edge torn up. The second board was replaced at no charge, and was carefully packed with foam on the edges, and came in perfect condition. I've already used the Boos oil and wax, and it looks fabulous--I almost hate to use a knife on it! The board is heavy but great for cutting up all my vegs and simply piling them up on the board, instead of putting into separate bowls. After using small cutting boards all these years, I can't believe I've never bothered to get one of these. If you are a real cook you need this!
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting board
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, durable, beautiful cutting board I love to cook so this is perfect for me. I recommend purchasing the mystery oil and board creme to preserve the life of the board
customer_reviews.author: T Luu

customer_reviews.title: This board easily handles carving and I'm not forced to carry the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is what a juice groove should be. Most cutting boards have a groove that overflows almost immediately when carving meat. This board easily handles carving and I'm not forced to carry the cutting board to the sink precariously balancing my roast to dump the overflow or wiping up the counter continuously. Oil it and apply board cream before your first use and monthly or bi-monthly thereafter, depending on frequency of use, and this quality boar will last a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: It is beautifully constructed and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This board is not only a practical cutting surface, it's a work of art. It is beautifully constructed and very sturdy. It's nice to have a moat for juices when carving a turkey, and it can be flipped over for a fully flat surface when cutting vegetables. Its weight practically eliminates slipping. After using a small board for years, this one feels like liberation. Oil it monthly to prevent cracking or warping, and you can expect this board to last for generations.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Boos, backs their warranty
customer_reviews.text: Boos usually makes good products and I have owned a few of them over the years. This one started splitting after just 5 months of use. Once they split, it’ll start to falling apart quickly. Yep, oiled and maintained as prescribed. This one just doesn’t hold up for me. **Updated review** Contacted customer service and they made it right by sending a replacement board as mine was within warranty. Very easy to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: Board split in 2!
customer_reviews.text: This board turned out to be a piece of crap! I have wanted one of these for many years and was finally able to afford one. Within a short time of having it the board started to spilt. I have done all the proper maintenance for the board with oiling regularly. The last time I cleaned it I had to work at removing crumbs from the crack and the whole board spilt in half! Very disappointed, wish I had purchased a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: MoHo

customer_reviews.title: Boos Cutting Board
customer_reviews.text: Board very sturdy. Have not really put it through it's real test. As a chef, so far this board has performed. Placed replaceable foot pads on side not currently using to keep food and water from settling on bottom side.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN PULLEY

customer_reviews.title: Splits and Warps
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this cutting block. It worked well for about a year, and then it developed a severe split in one of the laminated seams. After that, with washing, it developed a bad warp. I may just have had bad luck, but I will not buy this product again. It's less than 2 years old!
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it should be perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty materials, but there was a blister in the finish that, when I rubbed in some oil (included), turned into a cluster of splinters. Disappointing craftsmanship and quality control for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Librarian Man

customer_reviews.title: It's rather heavy so I'd recommend finding counter space and give it a home rather ...
customer_reviews.text: This was on my to do list for a while and now I wish I would have gotten it sooner. I am thrilled with the quality of this block. If you follow simple directions you will be able to keep it clean and it will surely prolong the life of it. I made my own disinfectant spray(vinegar, water, lemon) to clean it since you shouldn't use ones with chemicals. It's rather heavy so I'd recommend finding counter space and give it a home rather than stick it away when not in use. Not to mention it gives your kitchen a great look! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Happy Hubby
customer_reviews.text: My spouse loved the butcher block. I also got him the oils/conditioners. It was the *hit* Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Great but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: The board I received was not completely "finished" (meaning sanded smoothly), having high spots on one side that caused a rocking motion when used. This was not an ace breaker for me (I own a power sander that remedied the problem quickly). However, for the non-wood working kitchen guru I could see them being disappointed at the lack of proper quality control. Hence 4 stars vice 5. Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my Boos. It's big, it's heavy and it does the job as designed very well. I thoroughly recommend Boos for the serious kitcheneer.
customer_reviews.author: James Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a cutting board that would go along with buddies, beer, scotch, cigars, and grilling. This was definitely it. For me, I like the one that is a little thinner and easier to move around. Maple is great, and very hard wood. Reports now say that wood is more sanitary and carries less porous places than vinyl cutting boards. What a surprise, and a great one, because I love using natural products over plastic and vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: LdB

customer_reviews.title: tree bark works better then this
customer_reviews.text: cracked with in a year. dont bother this go buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, heavy duty cutting board
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. Much more beefy than it looks in the photos. Should come with some mystery oil but can be purchased separately. This is our new favorite cutting board but it’s so sweet almost afraid to cut on it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny T

customer_reviews.title: My favorite wedding gift
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, it is my fave. It's basically a countertop extender (I have ours on a cart, semi permanently). It's resilient and beautiful and I am happy. I use regular mineral oil and it is a-ok.
customer_reviews.author: A Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty! Lifetimes of service
customer_reviews.text: This is beautiful And well crafted , I’m sure it will last generations!! I wanted it to cover my glass top stove and it fits perfectly,,LOOKS BEAUTIFUL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marykay Anger

customer_reviews.title: Great board
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a couple years now. Have butchered meat on it, and cut all sundry sorts of foods. I clean it with a mild bleach solution then oil with block oil. It took a lot of wet sanding to get the perfect grain, though, but after that, it's a perfect board. Nice and heavy, so it doesn't move around on you, and I love the thickness, which serves to raise the height of the countertops for me.
customer_reviews.author: kagy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful slab of wood.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting board looks very nice in the kitchen, and allows a generous cutting surface.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Crain

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with X scratch not consistent with wood grain
customer_reviews.text: Nice block of wood-- but disappointed that it arrived with an X type marking not consistent with wood grain. As it is big and bulky.. not sure if it is worth repackaging and returning. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: dues

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome
customer_reviews.text: We love it! If I could give it 6 stars I would!
customer_reviews.author: J Wilson

customer_reviews.title: the best cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful cutting board! And I got a great price on it, so that was a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: S Lee

customer_reviews.title: Is there another wood block cutting board out there?  I don't care.
customer_reviews.text: This one is perfection. Bought it for my boyfriend before we moved in together and he became my fiance (girls take note! :)). He routinely tells me how much he loves it and usually applies the Boos Mystery Oil about once per month as evidence of his devotion. This can be a solid tool that holds up with care (and a little man love) for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: LaLa E.

customer_reviews.title: Like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This thing lasts through constant use, with both wet and dry ingredients, like a champ. We have only needed to oil it about 3 times within a year, and I expect the boos oil we bought to last a very very long time. Great investment, much more sturdy than the cheap $20 cutting boards you pick up in a big box store. The only thing we don't cut on it is raw meat, we have a glass board for that. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: AJRLS

customer_reviews.title: No box
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive cutting board. It was delivered to my porch without a box or covering of any kind. It's black with grime and gouged on one side. I wasn't too pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen J.

customer_reviews.title: Decent cutting board
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cutting board. I keep it on the counter because it is heavy, but the positive is that it is so big that it is very easy to work on. My food prep time is reduced by about 30% since I do not have to keep arranging the food like I did on a smaller board. When I store it, I push it off to the side. Then I slide it on the counter to the spot that I work when I need it. Better than a food processor.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Smith

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous cutting boards
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and they're gorgeous. They are solid as a rock, and just about as heavy. If you are going to be moving them more than just to clean around, note the weight. These are heavy suckers! They are quite beautiful and I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry N

customer_reviews.title: Have always loved Boos boards for their quality
customer_reviews.text: Have always loved Boos boards for their quality. This is an excellent price for this board. Workhorse size and substantial product for any cook that needs some serious prep space
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: A cutting board for this that need and love a serious prep surface.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my cutting board and wanted something better than a 3/4" board. This baby is awesome!!! Love it. It is both beautiful and highly functional. I also recommend the Boos cutting board oil. It will really soak up a lot at first so get an extra bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Clint H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, perfect, perfect. I am a restaurant owner, and amateur chef, and this is a wonderful block. Just don't get a hernia when you have to move it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Masuch

customer_reviews.title: Great butcher block
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this butcher block. I love to cook, and this makes chopping so much easier
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Arrived unfinished and with a "ding" on one side. ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived unfinished and with a "ding" on one side. I'm mounting it permanently (ding side down) or I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sundown

customer_reviews.title: boos chopping block
customer_reviews.text: Really love the size and quality of this, but was not happy with the packaging it was in, there was no filler in the box and the box was very large. Two corners of the chopping block had broken off. They were small flaws and I decided that I could live with them and didn't send back. I think Amazon should put packing fill in items like this in future. This is first item that I have received damaged.
customer_reviews.author: dsmom

customer_reviews.title: Good luck dealing with Boos customer support they will tell ...
customer_reviews.text: Board has bowed in the middle and is breaking on the glue line after just over a month of light use and cleaning. It has never been soaked in water or sat in water. Clearly the manufacturer is using wood that was not allowed to dry fully and is using cheap glue or shoddy techniques. Good luck dealing with Boos customer support they will tell you to pound sand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cutting board! Almost to beautiful to cut on! Great for expensive knifes, saves the cutting edge.
customer_reviews.author: J &H

customer_reviews.title: Expected Better
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly a nice board but for the price I expected something ready to use and this definitely wasn't. I had to buy 2 types of sandpaper and sand the whole board down before applying the oil. I bought the board cream and block cream at the same time and it required several overnight applications before I could even use the board. It seems to be a good product, heavy and solid (we'll see how long it holds up) but it required a substantial amount of work on my part to be fully functional. I really expected better based on the reputation of Boos cutting boards.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: BEST BAR NONE!
customer_reviews.text: Best cutting board out there...........my fifth. DO NOT WASH IN RUNNING WATER. And after cleaning, be sure to DRY COMPLETELY.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely stunning. This made-in the USA product instills immediate ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stunning. This made-in the USA product instills immediate pride in ownership worthy of prominent display in the most used space of my home. I selected the large 24 x 18 x 2 1/4 unit and mounted it to the top of a wire shelving unit I previously purchased at a national Storage Store (I drilled four 1 inch holes into the bottom of the board which sacrificed the reversibility of the board) . There is a huge wow factor when you first open the box and see that the unit was shipped with furniture-grade packing materials.
customer_reviews.author: Law Student

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cutting board for my girlfriend and she is obsessed. We almost never use any other cutting board now. This is really steardy and firm, and is extremely easy to clean - which was our biggest fear. We only have to oil it about once a month and it looks great in our kitchen. We even put our hot dishes on it since we don't have granite countertops.
customer_reviews.author: Zach and Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great cutting board--- Use it.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting board is very high quality. It will last a lifetime . Very happy with the service and the warranty that covers the product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Greene

customer_reviews.title: USA beautifully crafted hardwood cutting board
customer_reviews.text: Very well made of hardwood right here in the USA
customer_reviews.author: Dorchester Lower Mills resident

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: THE most beautiful, gorgeous hunk-o-wood I've ever purchased..This thing is HEAVY and it will probably out-live all of us. Its stunning and just a real quality MADE IN AMERICA product, forget Bed Bath and Beyond, treat yourself and buy from the "Little Guy".....This is GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra T

customer_reviews.title: Must Have in Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Best chopping block I’ve ever had! It’s durable and sturdy, very professional.
customer_reviews.author: FS

customer_reviews.title: Love, love this !
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I looked for a durable, heavy board for so long and am very pleased at this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 💯
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board as a gift for my dad. I was jealous the second i opened the box. Really beautiful wood, and the thickness really makes an impressive first impression. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: laurenkerwell

customer_reviews.title: Heavy! in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and doesnt move around even if you try. This thing is like 20lbs!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: John boos ra- cutting board
customer_reviews.text: I use this for making sushi . Nice very sturdy and heavy, its not moving while making rolls! Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: arsenio dela cruz jr

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought the John Boos reversible cutting board for my husband for Christmas. Within a week of use, the board had warped and a split appeared down the middle. Clearly this was not a cutting board that was meant for years of use. We used the beeswax board cream and had taken care of the board carefully. Returning it was not easy. Even though the board was flawed, I had to pay a restocking fee along with another fee that in total exceeded $30. I would not recommend this board or the return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Chambers

customer_reviews.title: warped in about 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my covered outdoor grill area. However, both of them warped such that they now rock and are not stable.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Geck MD

customer_reviews.title: great cutting board
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this cutting board and the quality. I would get the boos board cream and oil - I use both of them. I like that it is reversible to you can just turn it over if it starts to bend a little from moisture and it works itself out. I use it every day and bought one for a xmas gift for family too!
customer_reviews.author: Paige L. Burtson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cutting board.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, sturdy, huge (I wanted that). Probably not good with limited counter space.
customer_reviews.author: J. William Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty board
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a wedding shower gift for my granddaughter. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Rdub

customer_reviews.title: If possible I would give it no stars
customer_reviews.text: I had actually purchased and exchanged this product twice both times because the wood was split shortly after arrival (within 1 week). I had followed the care instructions exactly and oiled it right away. I guess it has been sitting in Amazon warehouse for too long and is already very dried out when it arrived. I had actually contacted the original manufacturer and they had graciously agreed to send me a replacement. The one that came from the manufacturer beautiful, well oiled and has not split in the 2 months that I have had it. I was unable to return the product for a refund because it had passed the 30day return period.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy NJ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: What A Fine Cutting Board Better than I expected, Love IT!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: GvilleWill

customer_reviews.title: To whom it may concern: Used the board twice ...
customer_reviews.text: To whom it may concern: Used the board twice and it has never been under running water. Flipped to use the other side and the board is already splitting apart. The separation was not present upon initial receipt and inspection. I ordered this product because of the maker and did not expect this to happen. Thanks, Matt L.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The large size is especially good for preparing entire meals - plenty of room for ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this cutting board daily. It's solid, heavy, and works perfectly. The large size is especially good for preparing entire meals - plenty of room for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boos is by far the best.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cutting board you can buy, you will not be let down. I got the 2-1/4 inch thick board, and believe it or not , it helps a tall guy since it brings the counter up higher, easier on the back. Your kitchen needs one if you do chopping, cutting and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Al

customer_reviews.title: A cut above
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cutting board. It isn't end-grain. End-grain boards are generally stronger and longer lasting, but that may only be necessary in professional kitchens. I've had no issues in 6+ months of daily use. It's a great everyday cutting board, for much cheaper than end-grain products. I've noticed it protects the edges of my knives quite well. I'm fanatical about keeping my knives razor sharp, so this is huge. Recommendations: 1) I like to put a towel underneath the board for added stability. Despite the size and weight, it slid a bit on my granite counter. 2) I recommend the "mystery oil" for bi-weekly care. You don't need much to give the wood a healthy look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Censky

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: It is a gift for my husband’s birthday next week. It is a surprise for him, I think the product is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Ramos-Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Must buy- worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months back, worth every single penny. I totally recommend this and would not hesitate to buy this product in the future. Well made, great workmanship-
customer_reviews.author: larwence thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Heavy. Thick. I use it as a countertop for a base cabinet with drawer acquired from Home Depot which is exactly the same size as the cutting board. Looks very nice! And it is functional.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful cutting board
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my picky son, who loves to cook. Beautiful cutting board! He was thrilled, I want one myself someday.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Habegger

customer_reviews.title: Heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Covers the top of a four burner stove nicely. Adds to the amount of counter top area you have to use. It's 2 1/2" thick so it's pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven King

customer_reviews.title: Cracked
customer_reviews.text: The board is great. Heavy, well built. Mine has developed a crack down the middle on one end. I have never submerged it, or washed it in a dishwasher and conditioned it following the instructions and using the boos conditioning cream and oil. Probably par for the course/hit or miss on a board this thick.
customer_reviews.author: techwriter

customer_reviews.title: I use this everyday!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this cutting board, it's really heavy and one of the best ones I have ever seen! I use it everyday and just keep it out on my counter. I have to because it's so heavy! Great buy and a super trustworthy name!
customer_reviews.author: RRichardson

customer_reviews.title: Greatest cutting board ever!
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason you see these wood boards in almost every Chef show on TV. These are the finest I have seen. You can go cheap and buy a $30.00 board and replace is every year, or buy the best and keep it working forever. Make sure you follow the manufacturer's recommendation on cleaning and oiling and this thing will last a long, long time!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful solid cutting board at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I chose the 18x24 version, and there is nothing like it in this price range. I'm very impressed with the quality, it works great as a board and I can't imagine having any problems with this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Receive board crack
customer_reviews.text: The board looks great except when I opened it up I notice a crack where the wood is glued. These boards are not cheap and when I or others spend the money for it you would want the product to be spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Wcc

customer_reviews.title: excellent product! Just be aware that you MUST oil ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent product ! Just be aware that you MUST oil and/or wax the wood every couple of weeks to prevent moisture from causing damage to the joints. But well worth the maintenance because your knives will stay sharper much longer than on those plastic boards, They dull your knives quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Jon F Fink

customer_reviews.title: poor glue
customer_reviews.text: The board has a seam that is opening up. The two months on the counter with foot buttons to raise board should not be a no return item.
customer_reviews.author: david cooper

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a product you will have forever
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful to use but mine has split in multiple places along the glue seams and as nice as it is, it's not worth the money. I truly thought when I purchased it that I would have it forever.
customer_reviews.author: William McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: I’ve loved my BOOS cutting block however the quality is not ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve loved my BOOS cutting block however the quality is not great - the block started to split in the middle about 4 months after I received it. I have oiled it regularly with the recommended product and now 2 years later it has split in 3 different locations on the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Lambros

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship and build quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an awful cutting board. The craftsmanship is poor as you can see gaps and it is not level.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Leafgreen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This board is beautiful, I treated it with the oil and cream and expect a lifetime of use!
customer_reviews.author: Holland Wino

product_meta.title: John Boos Block RA03 Maple Wood Edge Grain Reversible Cutting Board, 24 Inches x 18 Inches x 2.25 Inches
product_meta.description:
Bring home a culinary classic with a RA Board by John Boos. RA Boards are thick and hearty boards and measures an impressive 2.25 inches thick. Each RA board features sleek edge grain construction, resulting in a modern linear grain pattern. 

John Boos products are designed to meet the demanding expectations of commercial kitchens, and exceed the highest level of quality and food safety standards. Each board and block is made from sustainably harvested North American hardwoods, and offers a commercial grade cutting surface that protects the sharp edge on fine cutlery. Often imitated, John Boos and Co. is internationally known for its expertise in crafting American hardwoods into products of beauty, durability and function. 

Simple board care can ensure this heirloom, handcrafted board is a favorite in your kitchen for years to come. Every John Boos Board and Block comes with a food safe natural oil finish that helps protect the wood during transit. Once a month, apply an even coat of NSF Approved John Boos Mystery Oil (sold separately), and allow it to soak in overnight. Repeat this process more often when the board is brand new and “thirsty,” or if you live in a dry, arid climate. John Boos recommends applying John Boos Board Cream (also sold separately) to seal the top of the wood surface after applying the Mystery Oil. A few quick minutes of regular oil application will ensure your new board is properly seasoned, and ready for work! After use, wash board with warm, soapy water (all wooden cutting boards are not dishwasher safe and should not be soaked in water). All John Boos Cutting Boards and John Boos Butcher Blocks carry a 1 year Manufacturer’s warranty against defects in workmanship and materials. 

Since 1887, every genuine John Boos cutting board and butcher block has been proudly made in Effingham, Illinois by skilled craftspeople using time honored techniques. Today, USA made John Boos cutting boards and butcher blocks are used and loved in commercial and home kitchens worldwide. 

Boos Block Cream Finish w/Beeswax
feature_bullets: John Boos Block RA03 Maple Wood Edge Grain Reversible Cutting Board measures 24 inches long, 18 inches wide and 2.25 inches thick
Made in the USA: Each John Boos Butcher Block and Cutting Board is proudly made in Effingham, Illinois by skilled craftspeople using time honored techniques since 2088
Butcher block is made from sustainably sourced, hand-selected solid Northern Hard Rock Maple Wood- widely recognized as one of finest, most durable food preparation surfaces in the world

This board is reversible, both sides are flat and can be used as cutting surfaces. Integrated handgrips on each end make lifting, moving and cleaning this large board easy for all users. (RA boards weigh over 20 lbs.)
The RA series cutting boards by John Boos are hearty boards that measure a generous 2.25 inches thick. They have earned a reputation as a customer favorite

Care: hand wash and dry. Apply John Boos Mystery Oil regularly (more often in dry climates, and when the board is brand new), use John Boos Board Cream to seal the wood surface after applying Mystery Oil. Oil and cream sold separately on Amazon
1 Year Warranty: John Boos is proud to offer a one year guarantee against defects in workmanship and materials. RA Boards are NSF certified
The Professional Choice: Often imitated, Boos Boards and blocks are the preferred cutting surfaces of top chefs and restaurants around the world
Safe for fine cutlery: Wooden cutting boards are easier on knives than plastic boards (which can dull knives more quickly)
